definition: to chat
to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan

sentences.english: C. I'm usually the first person to strike up a conversation with strangers.
sentences.chinese: 我通常是最先与陌生人攀谈的人。

sentences.english: They conversed with the familiarity of a long-established acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他们俨然如老相识一样亲密无间地攀谈了。

sentences.english: He introduced himself to Comrade Wang, hoping to enter into conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 他向王同志作了自我介绍，想同他攀谈。

sentences.english: I had been waiting there some little time, when I was accosted by a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 我在那里等了好一会儿，后来有一位陌生人同我攀谈。

sentences.english: In the dancing party,a young girl latched onto the millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 在舞会上，一个姑娘主动和那个百万富翁攀谈起来。

sentences.english: A week after the tsunami, once again I went to talk to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 海啸发生一个星期后，我再次来到了海边，跟她攀谈。

sentences.english: He finds it hard to mix at parties.
sentences.chinese: 他感到很难在聚会上与人攀谈。

sentences.english: I spun around in my swivel chair and chatted with Jim.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在旋转椅上，扭过身，和吉姆攀谈了起来。

sentences.english: They hoped this expertise might help improve their chat-up technique.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望这种专家能帮忙改善自己攀谈的技巧。

definition: to discuss/to converse/chat/discussion
familiar/close
to chat/casual conversation
to chat
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
to exchange conventional greetings/to exchange pleasantries
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to greet sb by word or action/to give prior notice
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
intimate/friendly/warm/active/lively (interaction, participation etc)
to exchange conventional greetings/to talk about the weather
entertaining in conversation
to chat/idle talk
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to talk cheerfully and wittily/to joke together
to chat/to gossip
